key_messages.message: This would be the first time Canada is proposing a comprehensive legislative framework for stablecoins
Canada has an opportunity to lead again on financial innovation, creating a system that is safer, fairer, and more affordable for Canadians
Without clear rules, Canada risks falling behind other G7 nations and becoming dependent on U.S.-issued stablecoins
Stablecoin legislation has the potential to be a bipartisan issue and a national priority
A Canadian stablecoin framework could contribute over C$5 billion to GDP by 2030
Stablecoins could reduce remittance costs—Canadians currently pay 6-12% to send money abroad
A well-regulated stablecoin system could help make life more affordable for Canadians and support small businesses
The EU, U.S., Japan, and the U.K. have already implemented or drafted stablecoin regulations—Canada is catching up
Canadians are overpaying $8.5 billion per year on transaction fees compared to U.K. bank fees
86% of Canadians agree the financial system needs an update
The global stablecoin market is expected to grow from USD 240 billion to USD 1.6 trillion by 2030
72% of Canadians think regulation of cryptocurrency exchanges is important
